1.text: I lifted up my eyes again, and looked, and behold a man with a measuring line in his hand.

2.text: Then said I, Where go you? And he said to me, To measure Jerusalem, to see what is the breadth thereof, and what is the length thereof.

3.text: And, behold, the angel that talked with me went forth, and another angel went out to meet him,

4.text: And said to him, Run, speak to this young man, saying, Jerusalem shall be inhabited as towns without walls for the multitude of men and cattle therein:

5.text: For I, said the LORD, will be to her a wall of fire round about, and will be the glory in the middle of her.

6.text: Ho, ho, come forth, and flee from the land of the north, said the LORD: for I have spread you abroad as the four winds of the heaven, said the LORD.

7.text: Deliver yourself, O Zion, that dwell with the daughter of Babylon.

8.text: For thus said the LORD of hosts; After the glory has he sent me to the nations which spoiled you: for he that touches you touches the apple of his eye.

9.text: For, behold, I will shake my hand on them, and they shall be a spoil to their servants: and you shall know that the LORD of hosts has sent me.

10.text: Sing and rejoice, O daughter of Zion: for, see, I come, and I will dwell in the middle of you, said the LORD.

11.text: And many nations shall be joined to the LORD in that day, and shall be my people: and I will dwell in the middle of you, and you shall know that the LORD of hosts has sent me to you.

12.text: And the LORD shall inherit Judah his portion in the holy land, and shall choose Jerusalem again.

13.text: Be silent, O all flesh, before the LORD: for he is raised up out of his holy habitation.
